revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins.In the year 2001 coins were launched in the series: "Monuments of Material Culture in Poland", "Polish kings and princes", "The Animals of the World", "Polish Travelers and Explorers", "The Polish Calendar of Traditional Customs and Rituals" and various occasional coins. {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| Year 2001{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/rok2001_200zl.html | title=The Year 2001 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' external ring: Au900Cu100
internal ring: Au900Ag60Cu40
core: Au900Pd100 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 4,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 January 2001{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2001 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.20|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 2.000 zÅ {{Cite journal|title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In the central part an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Around the Eagle a stylised whirl. Above the Eagle the year of mintage: 2001. Around the inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA and 200 ZÅ. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: A stylised image of a woman and a man entering a tunnel, symbolising the future. On the left side a semicircular inscription: ROK 2001 (Year 2001). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| [[Amber Route]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/bursztyn_20zl.html | title=The Amber Route coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' 925/1000 Ag oxidised and [[amber]] | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 30,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Standard |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 21 February 2001 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 2.400 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the left side an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the left side an inscription: 20 ZÅ. Below: two silver Roman cups. Around an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA 2001. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: A stylised map of Europe with the Amber Route marked by stars. Above a piece of amber, below a denarius with an image of Nero. On the left side a semicircular inscription: SZLAK BURSZTYNOWY ([[Amber Route]]). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Monuments of Material Culture in Poland:'' [[Wieliczka Salt Mine|Salt-Mine in Wieliczka]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/wieliczka_20zl.html | title=The Salt Mine in Wieliczka coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-20}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' 925/1000 Ag and [[zirconium]] | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 25,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 21 March 2001 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 750 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland, on the background of a stylised fragment of rock with salt veins. Below the Eagle, on the left side, the notation specifying the year of mintage: 2001, on the right side inscription: 20 / ZÅ. Above a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA, below, on the background of stylised rock, an inscription: POLSKA. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: A scene presenting work in a salt mine in the past centuries: in central part an image of four miners rolling a block of salt, in the background: miners at work. Above an inscription: KOPALNIA SOLI (Salt Mine), below zirconium imitating a crystal of salt and an inscription: W WIELICZCE (in Wieliczka). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[WÅadysÅaw I Åokietek]] (1320â1333){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/lokietek_100zl.html | title=The WÅadysÅaw I Åokietek coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-19}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Obverse designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska,

Below the dates: 1674/1696. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polish Travelers and Explorers:''''' MichaÅ Siedlecki (1873â1940){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/siedlecki_10zl.html | title=The MichaÅ Siedlecki coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-25}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 26,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 7 November 2001 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 150zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the right side, an inscription: ROK 2001. Below a stylised images of two fish of tropical seas, corals and marine plants. Above a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA 10 ZÅ. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: An image of MichaÅ Siedlecki. On the left side an inscription: MICHAÅ / SIEDLECKI, below in a circle fauna of sea plankton in various microscopic enlargements by MichaÅ Siedlecki's drawing. Below, the dates 1873 / 1940. |- | colspan="4" |   |- |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''The Polish Calendar of Traditional Customs and Rituals:'' [[Christmas Carol|Carolers]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2001/kolednicy_20zl.html | title=The Carolers coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-25}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' 925/1000 Ag oxidized and [[zirconium]] | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 55,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Standard |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 5 December 2001 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 800 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the [[KrakÃ³w szopka|KrakÃ³w's crib]] with an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland incorporated in a gate. On the right side, in the background of a fragment of the crib an inscription: 20 / ZÅ. On the left side below, a notation of the year of issue: 2001. Upwards a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Under the left talon of the Eagle the mint mark: m/w. Reverse: In the central part a group of carolers with a star in zirconium. In the background willows, church and cottages. On the left and on the right bush branches.
